abstract: Margin Call, movie which recounts 24 hours in the life of an unnamed financial firm facing a crisis, takes a quieter, more realistic approach to portraying the financial world than the Wall Street movies that have come before it; first-time writer and director J C Chandor made movie in attempt to understand the human side of a financial crisis.
snippet: Most Wall Street movies, which must find drama in ticker symbols and balance sheets, tend to fall short of Wall Street reality, where fortunes can be won and lost with all the pomp of a mouse click.
lead_paragraph: Most Wall Street movies, which must find drama in ticker symbols and balance sheets, tend to fall short of Wall Street reality, where fortunes can be won and lost with all the pomp of a mouse click.

headline.main: Wall Street, With Calm, Not Hysteria
headline.print_headline: Wall Street, With Calm, Not Hysteria
headline.seo: ‘Margin Call,’ From J. C. Chandor, Looks at Wall Street
